page.title: 15MY LIFE 1 Joanne de la Taste
page.content: On a typical day we have three main meals and some snacks in between. We have breakfast in the morning,dinner at lunchtime and tea in the evening. Breakfast cereals are eaten with sugar and fresh milk which is delivered on the doorstep in the morning in bottles by a man in a van. For dinner we might have a joint with vegetables, potatoes and Yorkshire pudding. Sometimes we have a pudding or sweet like apple pie or a crumble of some kind. Things like sandwiches and cake are eaten for tea. We keep foods like cream, butter, milk, and cheese in the fridge because it keeps them cool and stores them longer. A typically English meal is fish and chips which we get from a chip shop. It is a fatty meal because the battered fish fillet and the chipped potatoes are deep fried in fat then served in newspaper.
